main event: A 13-year-old witness reported seeing several unidentified flying objects (UFOs) on multiple occasions in South Easton, Massachusetts in 1966.
interesting points: The witness reported seeing three different UFO sightings on separate occasions, described as white lights turning into larger red lights, moving slowly with various colors, and a white light moving slowly with no sound.
The witness contacted Otis Air Force Base to report the sightings and descriptions of the strange objects in the sky.
The witness read an article in Science Digest magazine about UFOs and was nervous but happy when observing the objects, stating they did not panic.
The witness requested more information on UFOs from the Project Blue Book Information Office in Washington, D.C.
The report concludes that the information provided is insufficient for evaluation of the sighting data and other evidence.
sighted object: unidentified flying objects (UFOs) described as white lights, red lights, and multi-colored objects
witnesses: 13-year-old civilian witness and 3 other reliable people
